1:
Then Bildad the Shuhite answered and said,
\q
2:
"When will you stop your talk?
\q Consider, and afterwards we will speak.
4:
You who tear at yourself in your anger,
\q should the earth be forsaken for you
\q or should the rocks be removed out of their places?
6:
The light will be dark in his tent;
\q his lamp above him will be put out.
8:
For he will be thrown into a net by his own feet;
\q he will walk into a pitfall.
11:
Terrors will make him afraid on every side;
\q they will chase him at his heels.
12:
His wealth will turn into hunger,
\q and calamity will be ready at his side.
\q
13:
The parts of his body will be devoured;
\q indeed, the firstborn of death will devour his parts.
14:
He is torn from the safety of his tent
\q and marched off to the king of terrors.
\q
15:
People not his own will live in his tent
\q after they see that sulfur is scattered within his home.
17:
His memory will perish from the earth;
\q he will have no name in the street.
18:
He will be driven from light into darkness
\q and be chased out of this world.
\q
19:
He will have no son or son's son among his people,
\q nor any remaining kinfolk where he had stayed.
\q
20:
Those who live in the west will be horrified at what happens to him one day;
\q those who live in the east will be frightened by it.
21:
Surely such are the homes of unrighteous people,
\q the places of those who do not know God."
